ygData.subject: RE: Shining Star of Light
ygData.msgSnippet: I did the pelts quest today and know that it gives great xp and I m 99% sure it raises priestsoflife.  I ll check to make sure though.  I can t imagine why it
ygData.messageBody:
I did the pelts quest today and know that it gives great xp and I'm
99% sure it raises priestsoflife. I'll check to make sure though. I
can't imagine why it would not. It is a priests of life quest after
all.

But, keep in mind, I play on test. So maybe it will get fixed to the
real servers eventually. I understand another production update is
being applied tomorrow. Would be interesting to see if they fix this
on the production-side.

It works on test, and is an awesome xp increaser.


>From: Ralph Carothers <CarothersR@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: "'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'" <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Shining Star of Light
>Date: Tue, 21 Sep 1999 15:49:45 -0400
>
>the pelts USED to work....just like the ale quest from freeport it was
>removed though. They beleive that it was too easy to up your faction and
>they changed it. I got pelts from a friend, AND slaughtered like 30 of the
>lil buggers and, with the same patch that killed the Ale quest in freeport,
>found the factions were now screwed in Qeynos too with easy quests.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Heather Daley [mailto:blushn@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 3:46 PM
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Shining Star of Light
>
>
>From: "Heather Daley" <blushn@...>
>
>I will agree the oil and prayer beads are a better form of gaining faction,
>however when I stated skellies and pelts I was not speculating I was
>stating
>
>fact, I personally used the skellies and pelts ONLY to raise my faction at
>the time(it was a quite awhile ago). My paladin friend however used the
>quests in conjunction with the others to help himself.
>
>
> >From: Ralph Carothers <CarothersR@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> >To: "'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'" <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
> >Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Shining Star of Light
> >Date: Tue, 21 Sep 1999 14:56:43 -0400
> >
> >the skeles I can not confirm.
> >
> >Oil, the prayer beads and turning in skele bone chips does work. The one
> >where you get a moonstone works.....
> >
> >PELTS....doesnt. It (unless they changed it last patch) was "fixed" Not
> >even the fleshy orb gave anything.....I tried this for over 10
>hours....and
> >learned the factions for temple of life ;) the prayer beads quest is a
> >VERy
> >nice faction upper btw. but long.
> >
> >Bann
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Heather Daley [mailto:blushn@...]
> >Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 2:53 PM
> >To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> >Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Shining Star of Light
> >
> >
> >From: "Heather Daley" <blushn@...>
> >
> >Our guildmaster, who is a paladin, just recently needed to raise his
> >faction
> >
> >with the priests of Life, in order to obtain his soulfire sword.
> >Basically what we did to help raise his faction was:
> >1) killing putrid skellies in South Karana(at Grimrots Camp)
> >2) Turning in diseased animal pelts to the Temple of Life
> >3) Doing the Blessed oil Quest til he turned green
> >
> >These will all raise your faction there. Even I, a person who originally
> >came from the temple of Life, needed to raise my faction in order to do
>the
> >quest. But to be quite honest, I did the quest simply cause I had never
> >done
> >
> >a quest before, I tried the weapon out like once to see what the effect
>was
> >and it has sat in the bank ever since.
> >
> >Bree Wyndsdale
> >47th Cleric of Fennin Ro
> >
> >

>Marr

> > >Freeport. Will i have problems trying to do the quest, or will i be
>ok?
